Not sure what we were getting into as it's a hotel restaurant, but the food was really really good! The prime rib was tender & flavorful, & the fish was cooked perfectly.  The mixed drinks were OK, but they had a nice variety of beers & wine.  The staff was friendly & professional.  We would definitely come back.

Last night I had the charcuterie board and it was fantastic! Tonight, I had grilled watermelon wrapped in prosciutto, a Caesar Salad with chicken and I wrote home about it! Literally!! I live 45 minutes away and my husband and I are already planning to visit in the next week! It's new and it is a MUST!

Went here while visiting Family in Scottsdale, They tried the four course dinner with beers special. Each course was served with a beer that complimented the dish. They loved it, I had the ginger miso salmon. It was cooked perfectly and the flavor was excellent. If I find Myself in the area again, I will definitely come back.

If they had brought my coffee on time , I might have gone for two stars, but service counts . So does food, and the food here is not impressive . My charcuterie platter had WallMart meats and cheese; presumably that's because the Indian management of this restaurant don't know better. That would also explain the lack of mustard and the good nan. My wife's burger? For that there is no explanation or digestion. However, the attitude of the management when apprised of our discontent was exceptional and for that they should be complimented. They took criticism and suggestions to heart and refused payment, instead asking that we come back again with the hope that they work towards improvement. That is a really good way to approach negatives.

Really excited to finally have a chance to check this place out. Wasn't too sure about it before since the ratings on Yelp were either very good or bad. Maybe it's because I came on a Tuesday night but it was very dead. I think there were only three parties (including my table) the entire night. I give this place three stars instead of two because the staff were really nice and attentive. However the food was merely okay. 

I ordered the "Taste of Summer" salad - lettuce was brownish green and huge clumps of cheese. The portion was very generous even though I got the smaller size. For entree, I ordered the Chicken Indian Curry and the "Build Your Own Classic French Gourmet Burger Dinner" - thought both were nothing too special. The French fries that came with the burger were pretty good though. For dessert, I ordered the Peach Cobbler since they said the Bread Pudding would take a long time to make (was quite disappointed about that). It was also okay. I'm not sure if I would order it again. 

Overall, I would like to give this place another chance. Maybe on a Friday or Saturday night. I heard that they have live music! Did I mention that the patio is dog friendly as well? That's definitely a plus in my book.
This place was great!  Service was phenomenal.  I had the chef's Niger and it didn't disappoint.  Would come back anytime.

Went to this place again and loved it again!!! Brandon is an amazing bartender! He made my wife a Fabulous Chocolate Thunder Martini and an Electric pink Cosmo. The thunder was so good we ended up having 2 each. His Margarita is the best I have had in Arizona. We had the Ribeye Delmonico that was delicious and the Chicken Alfredo that was very good as well.
I think 1 star is to much this place is just awful way over priced and the food is probably the worst in the valley

This place may have the same name as the last but this is under new ownership! They have a two page menu with tapas,salads, burgers, and entrees. They also have an horederve  section for $7 and you pick three of the 5 options. We got the grilled watermelon and prosciutto, goat cheese and salmon, and the blue cheese truffle- each flavorful and delicious (side note a bit salty)  we then each got salads the Asian and the Caesar - both good but recommend the Asian.  We finished with the bread pudding which is just delicious French toast!! 
Great layout and great service! Will be back!
This restaurant is gorgeous on the inside! Their menu is 5 stars and their service is amazing. If you ever have a moment to check it out I highly recommend it!

Coming in on a Friday night there was a huge crowd in the bar area. I was afraid there was a long wait but the hostess was able to seat us immediately. Turns out there was a special event going on. 

It was great people watching for my date and I as it clearly was a 50 and over singles ready-to-mingle event. Service was good and decor was nice. There were only a handful of tables aside from us and the special group. Food was good and freshly made. The wait proved that but luckily we had good entertainment and glasses of wine to hold us over. I had the Seafood Cioppino (sp?) and my husband had a ribeye steak. Both were good but you're looking at $40/ person with drinks. For that price, I'm kinda looking for more.

We were a little concerned when we first arrived at 10:30am and they were closed. Online their hours are supposed to be from 7am-10pm. Someone came to the door and said they wouldn't be open until 11 because the cook hadn't arrived yet. Odd for a place that serves breakfast. We were a little annoyed but since we wanted to use the Groupon we had we returned at 11. We sat at the bar  and took notice that the place might have recently been renovated and has a modern vibe with nice lighting, several booths and is quite large. We wanted to take advantage of the Happy Hour All Day on Sundays but the manager informed us there was no bartender but he would be more than happy to oblige us. My husband went through the paces of how to make a Margarita and he did a great job. We ordered the chef southwest burger with sweet potato fries and it was very good. The burger was juicy and the sauce that came with it had a slight spiciness and we were told it had chipolte spice in it. We were the only customers in there and left around 12 noon. The serve was great as was the food. I hope they make it because it would be nice to have a good restaurant in the neighborhood.
